author: jimmygchen
content:
Great post, thanks <@555483069038198827>!

<@602753420033785856> actually implemented something very similar to what you described as "decentralized blob building" for Deneb in Lighthouse as an optimisation (https://github.com/sigp/lighthouse/pull/5829) This does require adding a `getBlobs` engine api endpoint though, but I think this *may* be worth doing (or even include it as a  recommendation in spec?) as it could help reducing the rate that self builders' blocks get re-orged. It seems to work quite reliably from what I heard, and I think it may be useful for PeerDAS too - keen to do this experiement in PeerDAS and hear thoughts on spec inclusion.

The 2nd proposed approach does require having a supernode peer  - I wonder how much slower if we remove the supernode assumption, i.e. sending 50%+ samples to 1 peer per subnet, and waiting for supernode to receive and reconstruct. This probably means 0 to many extra hops compared to a direct supernode connection. Although i think the two techniques suggested compliment each other - if supernode is able to reconstruct from mempool faster than getting it from gossip, do that, otherwise wait for gossip. (FYI there was a similar discussion on this thread (https://discord.com/channels/595666850260713488/1247156108263555185/1247156110146928640)
  
This may be a short-mid term optimisation though - it sounds like ePBS fixes this (from <@363800010518822915>'s X post here https://x.com/terencechain/status/1802364710215700577)
